pkgmetadata.longdescription: Fit Interpretable Models and Explain Blackbox Machine Learning // Machine Learning package for training interpretable models and explaining blackbox systems. Historically, the most intelligible models were not very accurate, and the most accurate models were not intelligible. Microsoft Research has developed an algorithm called the Explainable Boosting Machine (EBM) which has both high accuracy and intelligibility. EBM uses machine learning techniques like bagging and boosting to breathe new life into traditional GAMs (Generalized Additive Models). This makes them as accurate as random forests and gradient boosted trees, and also enhances their intelligibility and editability. Details on the EBM algorithm can be found in the paper by Rich Caruana, Yin Lou, Johannes Gehrke, Paul Koch, Marc Sturm, and Noemie Elhadad (2015, doi:10.1145/2783258.2788613).
